narratives.question_text: What was valuable about this class, either in format or content?
comments: This was a great introduction to working at Yale and also a great review of basic technical theater practices. It was really great to cover a bunch of things that folks might take for granted to ensure that everyone has a thorough and proper understanding of technical theater and sound practices. I found the handouts and lectures to be totally helpful when paired together as they made note taking super efficient. The way the course was structured was also very organized.
This class provided both a structural learning environment as well as a hands on approach that I felt was extremely valuable in learning new skills and knowledge.

narratives.question_text: Are there adjustments, additions or deletions that might be beneficial?
comments: Nope. This is a good class.

narratives.question_text: Were there any particular challenges that were difficult to overcome?
comments: It might sound a bit counterintuitive, but some of the *really* basic theater stuff can be intimidating because you feel like you should know it and it's embarrassing if you don't but there's no way around that.

narratives.question_text: Do you have any comments about the teaching/learning environment?
comments: I love how friendly and casual the class is while still being productive.
Having an environment with such a few amount of students was incredibly helpful by having the one on one focus to push forward.

narratives.question_text: Please provide any other constructive comments below.
